intro: Salsola amblyostegia, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is a low-growing, perennial shrub that typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, green to blue-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are usually pink to purple in color. Salsola amblyostegia is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability.
